title: Textile, "Virtual Fruit", 2003
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: digital inkjet printed with acid dyes
description: Length of digitally printed silk with layered pomegranate-like forms creating an abstract pattern of intersecting circles, in subtle shades of tan and taupe.
justification: Virtual Fruit (2003) achieves&nbsp;a sense of movement through randomization of pattern over extended lengths, rather than by repetition. The subtle tonal gradation and sense of transparency typical of Ujiie’s work and showcased in this work is only possible with inkjet technology. While it is theoretically possible to print millions of colors with a four-color printing process, Ujiie uses this color precision instead in the creation of layered dimensional effects and subtle color blending

exhibitions.title: Design Life Now: National Design Triennial 2006

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, "Virtual Fruit", 2003.
2003. Medium: silk
Technique: digital inkjet printed with acid dyes. Gift of Hitoshi Ujiie. 2006-10-1.
